page.title: 01 General Nature of D_block
page.content:
An area of almost entirely agricultural land. Stockton, the largest settlement, is no more than a small hamlet grouped around a church. Most of the buildings in the area are farmhouses and farm buildings of various types and ages.
The area includes two rivers _ the Severn and the Worfe. Rising above the Severn is Apley Terrace, a sandstone escarpment covered in woodland. Nearby are part of the grounds of Apley Park, now a residential school.
The only main road to cross the area is the {A442 }from Telford to Bridgnorth.
